name: Black Mustard
overview: Not native to California, this annual herb poses a moderate threat. The small (1 mm) seeds are hard and vary in color from dark brown to black. They are flavorful, although they have almost no aroma. The seeds are commonly used in Indian cuisine, for example in curry, where it is known as rai.
habitat: Native to Eurasia, it is found mainly in Illinois, but also occurs in California. It is an invasive plant, meaning it causes harms to any ecosystem it lives in, it prefers disturbed areas such as weedy meadows, thickets, roadsides, vacant lots, and vernal pools. It does not invade high quality natural areas to any significant degree.
